title: 110_hr5991
content: The Act titled "Tax Relief for Transportation Workers Act of 2008" introduces a refundable credit for obtaining Transportation Worker Identification Credentials under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Tax Relief for Transportation Workers Act of 2008 allows individuals to claim a credit for qualified expenses incurred in obtaining a valid transportation worker identification credential. The credit is limited to the taxpayer's regular tax liability and Social Security taxes for the taxable year. The Tax Relief for Transportation Workers Act of 2008 allows a credit for qualified expenses, including fees under section 70105 of title 46, US Code, and legal expenses for obtaining a transportation worker identification credential. No double benefit is allowed. Conforming amendments are made to section 1324(b) of title 31, US Code. Amendment made to section 1324(b) of title 31, US Code, regarding transportation worker identification credential expenses. Section 36 of the Code is also addressed in the table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The amendments made by this section apply to transportation worker identification credentials expenses incurred before or after the enactment of this Act. Deduction for obtaining transportation worker identification credentials on behalf of employees is added to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The deduction for obtaining transportation worker identification credentials on behalf of employees allows for a 40 percent deduction of qualified expenses paid for obtaining valid credentials. Qualified expenses include fees under section 70105 of title 46, legal expenses, and other expenses related to obtaining the credential. The deduction for obtaining transportation worker identification credentials allows for a 40 percent deduction of qualified expenses paid for obtaining valid credentials under section 70105 of title 46. The term 'employee' is defined as in section 401(c)(1), and no deduction is allowed if the taxpayer elects not to apply this section to the expense. The amendments made by this section regarding transportation worker identification credentials apply to expenses incurred after the enactment of this Act.
